title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

1 point: Consorting with prostitutes. No Latin citation required.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point: Consorting with prostitutes. No Latin citation required.

Student response earns one of the available points.

1 point: Consorting with prostitutes. No Latin citation required.

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

Characteristics (1 point):

1 point: Very strict, austere. No Latin citation required.

Latin to support answer (2 points):

2 points: Reference to the Latin and a translation/paraphrase required for each item. The identification may be contained in the translation. Minimal Latin underlined. Answers: ab huius saeculi licentia (from the per-missiveness of the current age); a maiorum consuetudine atque concessis (from the practice and allowances of our ancestors). In the second answer, either maiorum consuetudine or maiorum...concessis is acceptable.

title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

1 point: Anaphora or tricolon crescens. (Rhetorical question, while not on the required list, is also acceptable.)
